greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} n XOR k where XOR is the bitwise logical exclusive-or operator.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) = Sum_{j=1..n} 4^(v_2(j)), where v_2(j) is the exponent of highest power of 2 dividing j. - _Ridouane Oudra_, Jun 08 2019
a(n) = n + 3*Sum_{j=1..floor(log_2(n))} 4^(j-1)*floor(n/2^j), for n>=1. - _Ridouane Oudra_, Dec 09 2020
program: for k in range(n):  s += n ^ k
(PARI) a(n) = sum(k=0, n, bitxor(n, k)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 08 2019
results.author: _Alex Ratushnyak_, Apr 19 2013
